item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Somali, AU Forces Face Resurgent Al-Shabab
item.description:
Somali, AU Forces Face Resurgent Al-Shabab

The Islamic State militant group claimed its first ever attack in Somalia earlier this week, though the claim has not been verified. Meanwhile, al-Shabab militants have stepped up their attacks as Somalia gears up for elections later this year.

item.title: Al-Shabab Fighters Loyal to Islamic State Complicate Somalian Security
item.description:
Al-Shabab Fighters Loyal to Islamic State Complicate Somalian Security

Members of al-Shabab in Somalia who recently pledged allegiance to Islamic State are moving into the Somalian capital of Mogadishu, according to a senior intelligence analyst.

item.title: International Funding Needed to Rescue South Sudan's Economy
item.description:
International Funding Needed to Rescue South Sudan's Economy

Two and a half years of civil war have destroyed South Sudan's economy. The country's leaders now say they need urgent international support to rebuild the country and restore peace. When South Sudan gained independence in 2011, its oil wealth made its government one of the richest in East Africa.

item.title: China Passes New Law Governing Foreign NGOs
item.description:
China Passes New Law Governing Foreign NGOs

China has passed a new, controversial law imposing new rules on foreign non-governmental organizations - NGOs - despite concerns from the West. The measure passed Thursday has not been revealed in detail, but earlier descriptions of the legislation said it would govern such groups as foreign charities, business associations and academic institutions.

item.title: Afghanistan Outraged About Taliban's Pakistan Visit
item.description:
Afghanistan Outraged About Taliban's Pakistan Visit

Afghanistan has criticized Pakistan for allowing a Taliban delegation to visit the neighboring country, saying "a terrorist organization" should not have been been allowed to undertake such activities. The objection came a day after the Islamist insurgency confirmed a three-member Taliban delegation traveled to Islamabad from its Qatar-based political office for talks with Pakistani officials on "border-related issues" and "problems" facing Afghan refugees in the country.
